title.raw: 《列傳‧伯夷列傳》 Biographies - Biography of Bo Yi

sentences.zh: 夫學者載籍極博，猶考信於六藝。

translations.literal: Scholars' recorded writings are extremely broad, yet they still verify trustworthiness from the Six Classics.

sentences.zh: 詩書雖缺，然虞夏之文可知也。

translations.literal: Though Poetry and Documents are incomplete, yet the writings of Yu and Xia can be known.

sentences.zh: 堯將遜位，讓於虞舜，舜禹之閒，岳牧咸薦，乃試之於位，典職數十年，功用既興，然後授政。

translations.literal: Yao was about to abdicate the throne, yielded to Yu Shun, between Shun and Yu, the mountain officials all recommended him, then tested him in position, managed duties for several decades, merits and functions having flourished, then transferred the administration.

sentences.zh: 示天下重器，王者大統，傳天下若斯之難也。

translations.literal: Showing the world the heavy vessel, the king's great succession, transmitting the world is so difficult.

sentences.zh: 而說者曰堯讓天下於許由，許由不受，恥之逃隱。

translations.literal: Yet storytellers say Yao yielded the world to Xu You, Xu You did not accept, ashamed and fled to hide.

sentences.zh: 及夏之時，有卞隨、務光者。

translations.literal: And in Xia's time, there were Bian Sui and Wu Guang.

sentences.zh: 此何以稱焉？

translations.literal: How is this to be regarded?

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余登箕山，其上蓋有許由冢云。

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: I ascended Mount Ji, above it apparently has Xu You's tomb.

sentences.zh: 孔子序列古之仁聖賢人，如吳太伯、伯夷之倫詳矣。

translations.literal: Confucius sequenced the ancient benevolent sages and worthy men, like Wu Taibo, Bo Yi and such in detail.

sentences.zh: 余以所聞由、光義至高，其文辭不少概見，何哉？

translations.literal: I consider what I have heard of Xu You and Wu Guang's righteousness extremely high, their literary writings not a little visible in overview, why?

Scholars' recorded writings are extremely broad, yet they still verify trustworthiness from the Six Classics. Yao was about to abdicate the throne, yielded to Yu Shun, between Shun and Yu, the mountain officials all recommended him, then tested him in position, managed duties for several decades, merits and functions having flourished, then transferred the administration. Showing the world the heavy vessel, the king's great succession, transmitting the world is so difficult. Yet storytellers say Yao yielded the world to Xu You, Xu You did not accept, ashamed and fled to hide. And in Xia's time, there were Bian Sui and Wu Guang. How is this to be regarded? sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「伯夷、叔齊，不念舊惡，怨是用希。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Bo Yi and Shu Qi, do not remember old evils, resentment thus rare.'

sentences.zh: 「求仁得仁，又何怨乎？」

translations.literal: 'Sought benevolence and obtained benevolence, moreover what resentment?'

sentences.zh: 余悲伯夷之意，睹軼詩可異焉。

translations.literal: I pity Bo Yi's intent, seeing the lost poem is wondrous.

sentences.zh: 其傳曰：

translations.literal: The biography says:

Confucius said: 'Bo Yi and Shu Qi, do not remember old evils, resentment thus rare.' 'Sought benevolence and obtained benevolence, moreover what resentment?' I pity Bo Yi's intent, seeing the lost poem is wondrous. The biography says:

sentences.zh: 伯夷、叔齊，孤竹君之二子也。

translations.literal: Bo Yi and Shu Qi were the two sons of Lord Gu Zhu.

sentences.zh: 父欲立叔齊，及父卒，叔齊讓伯夷。

translations.literal: Father wished to establish Shu Qi, when father died, Shu Qi yielded to Bo Yi.

sentences.zh: 伯夷曰：「父命也。」

translations.literal: Bo Yi said: 'Father's command.'

sentences.zh: 遂逃去。

translations.literal: Thus fled away.

sentences.zh: 叔齊亦不肯立而逃之。

translations.literal: Shu Qi also refused to establish himself and fled.

sentences.zh: 國人立其中子。

translations.literal: The people of the state established their middle son.

sentences.zh: 於是伯夷、叔齊聞西伯昌善養老，盍往歸焉。

translations.literal: Thus Bo Yi and Shu Qi heard that Western Lord Chang was good at supporting the elderly, why not go and attach to him.

sentences.zh: 及至，西伯卒，武王載木主，號為文王，東伐紂。

translations.literal: When they arrived, Western Lord died, King Wu carried the wooden spirit tablet, called him King Wen, east to attack Zhou.

sentences.zh: 伯夷、叔齊叩馬而諫曰：「父死不葬，爰及干戈，可謂孝乎？

translations.literal: Bo Yi and Shu Qi grasped the horse and remonstrated saying: 'Father died not buried, moreover to weapons, can this be called filial?

sentences.zh: 以臣弒君，可謂仁乎？」

translations.literal: With minister killing lord, can this be called benevolent?'

sentences.zh: 左右欲兵之。

translations.literal: The attendants wished to kill them with weapons.

sentences.zh: 太公曰：「此義人也。」

translations.literal: The Grand Duke said: 'These are righteous men.'

sentences.zh: 扶而去之。

translations.literal: Supported and sent them away.

sentences.zh: 武王已平殷亂，天下宗周，而伯夷、叔齊恥之，義不食周粟，隱於首陽山，采薇而食之。

translations.literal: King Wu having pacified the Yin disorder, the world revered Zhou, yet Bo Yi and Shu Qi were ashamed of it, righteousness not to eat Zhou grain, hid on Shouyang Mountain, gathered ferns and ate them.

sentences.zh: 及餓且死，作歌。

translations.literal: When hungry and about to die, composed a song.

sentences.zh: 其辭曰：「登彼西山兮，采其薇矣。

translations.literal: The lyrics say: 'Ascending that western mountain, gathering its ferns.

sentences.zh: 以暴易暴兮，不知其非矣。

translations.literal: With tyranny replacing tyranny, not knowing its wrongness.

sentences.zh: 神農、虞、夏忽焉沒兮，我安適歸矣？

translations.literal: Shennong, Yu, Xia suddenly gone, where shall I return?

sentences.zh: 于嗟徂兮，命之衰矣！」

translations.literal: Alas going, fate's decline!'

sentences.zh: 遂餓死於首陽山。

translations.literal: Thus starved to death on Shouyang Mountain.

Bo Yi and Shu Qi were the two sons of Lord Gu Zhu. Father wished to establish Shu Qi, when father died, Shu Qi yielded to Bo Yi. Bo Yi said: 'Father's command.' Thus fled away. Shu Qi also refused to establish himself and fled. The people of the state established their middle son. Thus Bo Yi and Shu Qi heard that Western Lord Chang was good at supporting the elderly, why not go and attach to him. When they arrived, Western Lord died, King Wu carried the wooden spirit tablet, called him King Wen, east to attack Zhou. Bo Yi and Shu Qi grasped the horse and remonstrated saying: 'Father died not buried, moreover to weapons, can this be called filial? With minister killing lord, can this be called benevolent?' The attendants wished to kill them with weapons. The Grand Duke said: 'These are righteous men.' Supported and sent them away. King Wu having pacified the Yin disorder, the world revered Zhou, yet Bo Yi and Shu Qi were ashamed of it, righteousness not to eat Zhou grain, hid on Shouyang Mountain, gathered ferns and ate them. When hungry and about to die, composed a song. The lyrics say: 'Ascending that western mountain, gathering its ferns. With tyranny replacing tyranny, not knowing its wrongness. Shennong, Yu, Xia suddenly gone, where shall I return? Alas going, fate's decline!' Thus starved to death on Shouyang Mountain.

sentences.zh: 由此觀之，怨邪非邪？

translations.literal: From this observing, is it resentment or not?
From this observing, is it resentment or not?

sentences.zh: 或曰：「天道無親，常與善人。」

translations.literal: Some say: 'Heaven's way has no partiality, constantly with good people.'

sentences.zh: 若伯夷、叔齊，可謂善人者非邪？

translations.literal: If Bo Yi and Shu Qi, can they be called good people or not?

sentences.zh: 積仁絜行如此而餓死！

translations.literal: Accumulated benevolence and pure conduct like this yet starved to death!

sentences.zh: 且七十子之徒，仲尼獨薦顏淵為好學。

translations.literal: Moreover among the seventy disciples' followers, Confucius alone recommended Yan Yuan as good at learning.

sentences.zh: 然回也屢空，糟糠不厭，而卒蚤夭。

translations.literal: Yet Yan Hui often was empty, did not reject coarse food, yet died young.

sentences.zh: 天之報施善人，其何如哉？

translations.literal: Heaven's reward and punishment for good people, what is it like?

sentences.zh: 盜蹠日殺不辜，肝人之肉，暴戾恣睢，聚黨數千人橫行天下，竟以壽終。

translations.literal: Dao Zhi daily killed the innocent, devoured people's flesh, tyrannical and arrogant, gathered bands of several thousand men rampaging the world, ultimately died of old age.

sentences.zh: 是遵何德哉？

translations.literal: This followed what virtue?

sentences.zh: 此其尤大彰明較著者也。

translations.literal: This is the especially great, clear, obvious, and evident case.

sentences.zh: 若至近世，操行不軌，專犯忌諱，而終身逸樂，富厚累世不絕。

translations.literal: If to the recent age, conduct and behavior not on track, specially violating taboos, yet lifelong leisurely pleasure, wealth and thickness continuing generations without end.

sentences.zh: 或擇地而蹈之，時然後出言，行不由徑，非公正不發憤，而遇禍災者，不可勝數也。

translations.literal: Some choose places and tread them, speak only after the time, walk not by crooked paths, not indignant unless just and upright, yet those who encounter calamities cannot be counted.

sentences.zh: 余甚惑焉，儻所謂天道，是邪非邪？

translations.literal: I am greatly confused about this, perhaps what is called heaven's way, is it so or not?

Some say: 'Heaven's way has no partiality, constantly with good people.' If Bo Yi and Shu Qi, can they be called good people or not? Accumulated benevolence and pure conduct like this yet starved to death! Moreover among the seventy disciples' followers, Confucius alone recommended Yan Yuan as good at learning. Yet Yan Hui often was empty, did not reject coarse food, yet died young. Heaven's reward and punishment for good people, what is it like? Dao Zhi daily killed the innocent, devoured people's flesh, tyrannical and arrogant, gathered bands of several thousand men rampaging the world, ultimately died of old age. This followed what virtue? This is the especially great, clear, obvious, and evident case. If to the recent age, conduct and behavior not on track, specially violating taboos, yet lifelong leisurely pleasure, wealth and thickness continuing generations without end. Some choose places and tread them, speak only after the time, walk not by crooked paths, not indignant unless just and upright, yet those who encounter calamities cannot be counted. I am greatly confused about this, perhaps what is called heaven's way, is it so or not?

sentences.zh: 子曰「道不同不相為謀」，亦各從其志也。

translations.literal: The Master said 'Ways different do not plan for each other', each also follows their will.

sentences.zh: 故曰「富貴如可求，雖執鞭之士，吾亦為之。

translations.literal: Therefore said 'If wealth and nobility can be sought, though holding the whip as servant, I also will do it.

sentences.zh: 如不可求，從吾所好」。

translations.literal: If cannot be sought, follow my likes.'

sentences.zh: 「歲寒，然後知松柏之後凋」。

translations.literal: 'Year's cold, then know pine and cypress wither late.'

sentences.zh: 舉世混濁，清士乃見。

translations.literal: The whole world turbid and mixed, clear gentlemen then appear.

sentences.zh: 豈以其重若彼，其輕若此哉？

translations.literal: Is it because their weight is like that, their lightness like this?

The Master said 'Ways different do not plan for each other', each also follows their will. Therefore said 'If wealth and nobility can be sought, though holding the whip as servant, I also will do it. If cannot be sought, follow my likes.' 'Year's cold, then know pine and cypress wither late.' The whole world turbid and mixed, clear gentlemen then appear. Is it because their weight is like that, their lightness like this?

sentences.zh: 「君子疾沒世而名不稱焉。」

translations.literal: 'Gentlemen hate dying in the world with name not fitting.'

sentences.zh: 賈子曰：「貪夫徇財，烈士徇名，夸者死權，眾庶馮生。」

translations.literal: Master Jia said: 'Greedy men pursue wealth, ardent knights pursue fame, boasters die for power, the masses rely on life.'

sentences.zh: 「同明相照，同類相求。」

translations.literal: 'Same brightness mutually illuminate, same kind mutually seek.'

sentences.zh: 雲從龍，風從虎，聖人作而萬物睹。」

translations.literal: Clouds follow dragon, wind follows tiger, sages arise and ten thousand things are seen.'

sentences.zh: 伯夷、叔齊雖賢，得夫子而名益彰。

translations.literal: Bo Yi and Shu Qi though worthy, obtained the Master and their name became more illustrious.

sentences.zh: 顏淵雖篤學，附驥尾而行益顯。

translations.literal: Yan Yuan though diligently studied, attached to horse's tail and conduct became more prominent.

sentences.zh: 巖穴之士，趣舍有時若此，類名堙滅而不稱，悲夫！

translations.literal: Mountain cave gentlemen, advance and retreat sometimes like this, their kind names buried and extinguished without being called, alas!

sentences.zh: 閭巷之人，欲砥行立名者，非附青雲之士，惡能施于後世哉？

translations.literal: Alley and lane people, those who wish to polish conduct and establish name, if not attaching to azure cloud gentlemen, how can they extend to later generations?

'Gentlemen hate dying in the world with name not fitting.' Master Jia said: 'Greedy men pursue wealth, ardent knights pursue fame, boasters die for power, the masses rely on life.' 'Same brightness mutually illuminate, same kind mutually seek.' Clouds follow dragon, wind follows tiger, sages arise and ten thousand things are seen.' Bo Yi and Shu Qi though worthy, obtained the Master and their name became more illustrious. Yan Yuan though diligently studied, attached to horse's tail and conduct became more prominent. Mountain cave gentlemen, advance and retreat sometimes like this, their kind names buried and extinguished without being called, alas! Alley and lane people, those who wish to polish conduct and establish name, if not attaching to azure cloud gentlemen, how can they extend to later generations?
